meanings.definition: The process of transplanting tissue from one individual to another of the same species.
meanings.sent1: Isografting can help save lives by replacing damaged tissue with healthy tissue from a similar individual.
meanings.sent2: The hospital performed an isografting procedure to transfer skin from one twin to the other.
meanings.sent3: During the isografting surgery, the doctors joked that the tissue was going on a little adventure to a new home.
meanings.sent4: The isografting process is like giving a piece of yourself to someone else, quite literally.
meanings.sent5: In the world of isografting, tissues travel from one body to another, like tiny explorers seeking a new home.

meanings.definition: The act of grafting tissue from a genetically identical donor to a recipient.
meanings.sent1: Isografting ensures that the tissue donor and recipient share the same genetic blueprint.
meanings.sent2: The success of the isografting procedure relied on the compatibility between the donor and the recipient.
meanings.sent3: The isografting operation was so precise that it seemed like a magical genetic puzzle coming together.
meanings.sent4: In isografting, tissues from one body seamlessly merge with another, like a genetic handshake.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of isografting lies in the perfect match between the donor tissue and the recipient, like pieces of a genetic puzzle fitting perfectly.
